title: Which organisations are responsible patients being delayed, when they're awaiting a care package in their own home?
analysis_commentary:
Despite the fact that overall most patients delays are attributable to the NHS, patients delays that are as a result of patients awaiting care packages in their own home are mainly attributable social care. This is for both the number of patients delayed (data not shown) and the number of days patients are delayed.

When looking at a comparable month of November in 2010 and 2015 there are 293 more patients per day delayed because of social care when waiting for a care package in their own home, and in December 2015 this represents 12 per cent of all patients delayed (data not shown). The number of delayed days caused by this has almost doubled between August 2010 and December 2015, and now represents 11 per cent of all delayed days.

For both the number of patients delayed and the number of delayed days the increases observed occur from May 2014 onwards and may be a result of major cuts to local government funding of social care for older adults in recent years
